meanings.definition: The quality of being reasonable or practical.
meanings.sent1: Her sensiblenesses helped her make wise decisions.
meanings.sent2: His sensiblenesses guided him to choose the most cost-effective option.
meanings.sent3: Even in the chaos, her sensiblenesses shone through.
meanings.sent4: His sensiblenesses were a compass in the storm of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The sensiblenesses of the plan ensured its success.

meanings.definition: The state of being aware of and responsive to one's surroundings.
meanings.sent1: His sensiblenesses allowed him to notice the subtle changes around him.
meanings.sent2: She moved with sensiblenesses, avoiding obstacles effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: His sensiblenesses were like having eyes in the back of his head.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, her sensiblenesses were as sharp as a fox's.
meanings.sent5: The child's sensiblenesses kept him safe in unfamiliar places.

meanings.definition: The ability to make sound judgments based on logic and reason.
meanings.sent1: Her sensiblenesses led her to the most logical solution.
meanings.sent2: His sensiblenesses were evident in his well-thought-out decisions.
meanings.sent3: The robot's sensiblenesses made it the smartest in the group.
meanings.sent4: His sensiblenesses were like a shield against hasty choices.
meanings.sent5: The sensiblenesses of the scientist revolutionized the field.
